content: vagabond scarf this scarf is worked side to side with a very gentle spiral increase similar to my emily scarf every stitch is worked into a chain space rather than into the top of another stitch the top and bottom long side borders of this asymmetrical scarf are worked as you go materials needed fingering weight yarn h hook yarn needle this pattern is done in back-and-forth row turning at the end of each row it also starts with a magic_ring if you prefer not to do a magic_ring you may ch3 or ch4 and join with a slip_stitch into a ring or whatever your favorite way to not do magic_ring would be the very first stitch is the no turning chain double_crochet tutorial available on youtube if you do not know how to do the no turning chain double_crochet or simply prefer not to you may substitute a ch3 to act as the first double_crochet special stitches shell 2dc ch1 2dc all worked into the same chain space increase shell 2dc ch1 2dc ch1 2dc all worked into the same chain space begin with magic_ring row 1 shell in magic_ring row 2 ch2 increase shell in chain space row 3 ch2 shell in first chain space ch1 2dc in last chain space row 4 ch2 2dc in first chain space ch1 increase shell in last chain space row 5 ch2 shell in first chain space ch1 2dc in next chain space 2 times row 6 ch2 2dc in next chain space ch1 2 times increase shell in last chain space row 7 ch2 shell in first chain space ch1 2dc in next chain space 3 times row 8 ch2 2dc in next chain space ch1 3 times increase shell in last chain space continue in this manner repeating the last two row but adding a repeat to ever other row basically every odd numbered row will start with a shell every even numbered row will end with an increase shell and every other chain space will have 2dc in it every stitch unit separated by a ch1 work until the scarf is at the desired length or until you run out of yarn i just went until my skein gave out and the top edge was nearly six feet long weave in ends block if desired lo and behold another crudely-drawn chart
